page.title: 02The Pig farm in Longdon
page.content: This venture started on June lst.1985 on leased premises previously used for pigs. It has room for 400 sows. There are{250 gilts}and{17 boars}and the first piglets are due on September 13th. The pigs are a cross between {Largewhite }and {Landrace }producing a breed called {Camborough. They also cross the old British breed of {Saddlebacks }with {Landrace} and produce {Camborough Blue}which has the qualities of both breeds. The former are a hardy out-door breed; the latter quickly grow fat on a minimal diet. The farm is contracted to supply 'weaners' (i.e. piglets, 13 weeks old, 32 kilos in weight) to a firm in Oxfordshire. The pigs are kept in straw yards. The land, being heavy clay is unsuitable for rearing them outdoors.
